channel.title: ¤¨¤± *extreemly* big problem! ±¤¨¤
channel.description:
[b]Alright[/b], lets not drag this thread out. Basically, I'm trying to get my server online, so that others may come online, and just not me.. I have a [i]SpeedStream 4200[/i] ~ Not sure if its a Modem or Router, but its a black box with cables/wires connected to my computer. ..[b][u]Heres the Catch:[/u][/b] After, I had gone to my Default Gateway, selected 'Setup' - Went to 'PortForwarding' and Portforwarded once with TCP, And UDP, Using 43594 as the Port in both boxes, I clicked Apply. - I then went to my firewall, and made two new Exceptions to my Firewall. [b]Port 1. Port 2. TCP. UDP. 43594. 43594.[/b] I then, went to [url=http://www.ipchicken.com]http://www.ipchicken.com[/url] ~ And got my IP. Afterwards, I got a friend to try and log into my server.. He couldn't connect.. [i]I thought something was wrong with his Client, so I decided to get a different person to try, instead...[/i]
Still, No Luck
[b][size=20pt][i]X_X;;[/i][/size] [/b] This problem has dragged on for too long. If anyone can provide some helpful posts, or information as to what would be the problem, I'm sure you'll be quite pleased with what I give to you in return.
[i]Regaurds: Jayy[/i][br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 08, 2007, 04:30:48 PM[/size][hr]Does ANYONE know whats wrong?! I'm growing more and more displeased with the problem as each second of the day goes by.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 08, 2007, 04:34:51 PM[/size][hr]... Anyone?!

item.title: ¤¨¤± *extreemly* big problem! ±¤¨¤
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Jayden Lord Jayden
item.description:
@Lord_Jayden wrote:

Exempt? :\ All I did was PortForward with UDP and TCP - And then went to my firewall and made two new exceptions.
A TCP 43594.
And a UDP 43594.

Read full topic

item.title: ¤¨¤± *extreemly* big problem! ±¤¨¤
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Jayden Lord Jayden
item.description:
@Lord_Jayden wrote:

Alright, lets not drag this thread out. Basically, I’m trying to get my server online, so that others may come online, and just not me…
I have a SpeedStream 4200 ~ Not sure if its a Modem or Router, but its a black box with cables/wires connected to my computer.
…Heres the Catch:
After, I had gone to my Default Gateway, selected ‘Setup’ - Went to ‘PortForwarding’ and Portforwarded once with TCP, And UDP, Using 43594 as the Port in both boxes, I clicked Apply. - I then went to my firewall, and made two new Exceptions to my Firewall.
Port 1. Port 2.
TCP. UDP.
43594. 43594.
I then, went to http://www.ipchicken.com ~ And got my IP.
Afterwards, I got a friend to try and log into my server…
He couldn’t connect… I thought something was wrong with his Client, so I decided to get a different person to try, instead…

Still, No Luck

[size=20pt]X_X;;[/size]
This problem has dragged on for too long. If anyone can provide some helpful posts, or information as to what would be the problem, I’m sure you’ll be quite pleased with what I give to you in return.

Regaurds: Jayy[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 08, 2007, 04:30:48 PM[/size][hr]Does ANYONE know whats wrong?! I’m growing more and more displeased with the problem as each second of the day goes by.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 08, 2007, 04:34:51 PM[/size][hr]… Anyone?!

Read full topic
